title: Will Love Island star Eoghan Murphy be the next Bachelor?
text:
Eoghan Murphy gained a legion of fans while appearing on the second series of the racy reality show, Love Island Australia.

And now, the 24-year-old has revealed he would be interested in finding love again as the next Bachelor.

Speaking to New Idea magazine on Monday, Eoghan said he wanted to be the leading man on Channel 10's 2020 season.

From the Fiji villa to the mansion? Love Island star Eoghan Murphy (ABOVE) expresses his desire to 'find love' as Channel 10's newest Bachelor

'Look, I'd never say never to anything, let's put it that way! I'm actually chasing something here… I actually want to find love,' he told the publication.

He went on to explain that Love Island certainly isn't a holiday, describing the idyllic Fijian villa as an 'emotional rollercoaster'.

'It was not a holiday,' he said, adding: 'It is an emotional rollercoaster. One day you're up, one day you're down. You never get comfortable.'

'They're not following any script, they're writing it as they go. No one can predict what's happening, everyone's on edge!'

'Look, I'd never say never to anything, let's put it that way! I'm actually chasing something here… I actually want to find love,' Eoghan told the publication

It comes after Eoghan opted to leave the villa in order to save his friend Matthew Zukowski on Monday's episode.

During his time on the show Eroghan found himself in a 'love square' with Matthew Zukowski, Jordan Cayless and Isabelle Green.

'I'm 100 percent okay with Matty going after Jordan!' he confessed, before joking he'd even happily get in on the action.

Stepping down: Eoghan Murphy (right) valiantly opted to leave Love Island during Monday's episode so that Matthew Zukowski (left) could stay during an emotional episode

'I'm thinking maybe all three of us all go for it... We'll make it work,' he added.

'I've kissed Matty a couple of times already, so how hard can it be to take that next step? It won't be too much of an issue.'

Eoghan said he and Matt were both instantly attracted to Jordan, 28, and Isabelle, 27, following their arrival, but there was never any competition.

Accepting: Despite finding himself in a 'love square' with Matthew, Jordan Cayless (left) and Isabelle Green, Eoghan said he'd also be open to his best friend dating his ex, Jordan

'My initial physical attraction was more for Isabelle, and Matty's was for Jordan. So, we agreed that I would go after Isabelle for the time being, and Matty would go after Jordan,' he explained.

But the spark just wasn't there for the newly formed couples, and shortly afterwards, Eoghan ended up with Jordan, and Matt ended up with Isabelle.

'Me and Matty were on the same page. Everyone was saying I stole his girl. That's not what happened at all! We knew what was going on,' he added.

'Me and Matty were on the same page. Everyone was saying I stole his girl. That's not what happened at all! We knew what was going on,' he added

Eoghan said that while he'd love to reconnect with Jordan outside of the show, he'd be happy for her and Matt, too.

'Obviously I'd like to meet up with Jordan on the outside, because we had a good connection, but if they ended up together, that would be okay, too,' he said.

He jokingly added: 'Actually, you know what, good on him if he won her back, it would be one all!'

Love Island Australia continues on Channel Nine, Tuesday, 8.40pm.
description: Eoghan Murphy gained a legion of fans while appearing on the second series of the racy reality show, Love Island Australia.
authors: Caleb Taylor For Daily Mail Australia
